p: Mannans consist of a D-mannose backbone, linked mainly by β1→4 bonds, which can be ramified with other monosaccharide, so originating glucomannan, galactomannan, and galactoglucomannan [ 57]. Furthermore, (β1→3)- or (α1→3)-, (β1→2)-, and (β1→6)- or (α1→6)-D-mannosidic bonds are reported [ 56]. The (β1→6)-D-mannan moiety (e.g., galctoglucomannans), acetyl and sulfate group presence, and this kind of branching seems to confer a high immunostimulatory activity [ 58, 59, 60].
